messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Annette. Today has been much better. I just hope my experience can help someone else to not get the virus. The hardest part of the car trouble is my
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Annette. Today has been much better. I just hope my experience can help someone else to not get the virus. The hardest part of the car trouble is my husband is on the road add was in New Jersey when the car broke down. Thankfully someone stopped and helped me. I had a carful of children at the time.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Annette Yunker
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 11:05 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus

Johanna, If there were an award to give you for going through all of this, I think you would win a unanimous vote!  Hope tomorrow is a great day for you.  Annette
----- Original Message -----
From: Johanna
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 11:44 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus

i think this particular worm is a replica of a previous one. Symantec's site listed it as first being reported on April 11th of this year. I ended up getting the Norton Utilites Systemworks. I had wanted to get it earlier, but kept putting it off for financial reasons. It automatically updates whenever you go online. Nice feaure. I had the day from hell yesterday anyway. Between the virus, car troubles and children troubles I wish uesterday had never happened. I got stuck at the dump of all places.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Annette Yunker
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 10:13 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus

Johanna - Do not feel bad about the lack of anti-virus software.  I have the software, yet I was affected. Everybody who uses the internet/e-mail knows they are open to this risk.  Thankfully, the software is available online.  No need to apologize (more on that later), although your apology is graciously accepted by all, no doubt.  By the way,  I have an extra McAfee program (got it free as an incentive for something else - e-mail me if you want me to mail it).  When I had the full suite on my older computer, it left too much running and slowed things down.  If this is a concern for you, have a self-proclaimed "expert" (the kind that do things for free) help you install it differently.  It has more than just anti-virus software on it.  Also, you'll need to update it often.  The Symantec I have know updates ever 14 days with an option to do it sooner. 
 
Back to the original thought here - no one blames you anyway (especially me).  Truth be known, I suspect that I got it from a very small, twelve woman list from a person who didn't know she had it.  By the time I figured out I had it, it had sent dozens, maybe hundreds of e-mails out - mostly to myself!  And I seem to have sent it to the 15,000+ Flylady list as well as the unschooling list.  If anyone has a red face here it's me.  So to all of you, I apologize.  What's strange is that I got rid of it days ago, and am surprised it just hit this list recently - I thought it probably hadn't.   I guess these worms are written so cleverly that the pause is intentional.  Since this was my first ever virus/worm, I am now well-schooled in the dangers of strangely and alluringly titled attachments.  However, I never received the enticement of nude photos. I've been LOL just thinking of those of you sitting out their staring at those attachment titles in bewilderment!!!
 
Please accept my humblest apologies,  Annette
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Johanna
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 10:21 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus

it waits about five minutes, then your incoming mail start going into your outgoing mail instead. the attachment is added and it comes through the inbox as if you sent it. If you are posting to a group. it seems to come as a personal response to a post someone has sent. If you download your mail, log off and read it, the worm won't activate until you log on the net again. did you open any attachments? It gives an error meassage stating "File data corrupt: probably due to a bad data transmission or bad disk access." I don't think it works if you don't open the attachment but I'm not sure. I hope you are ok. I feel really bad because I knew I needed to get antivrus software and hadn't done it yet. Finances can be tight sometimes.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Angela
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 6:33 AM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus

I tried to open a similar email from Valerie.  Hey Valerie are you out there?   Dh had just reloloaded out computer and I don't think the anti virus software got loaded on before he left for WA.  I want to make sure I am not spreading anything.  What happens with the virus?  NOthing seems to be wrong with my computer right now.
 
 

Angela in Maine.  Unschooling Mom to two beautiful daughters.  "Play is our brain's favorite way to learn." Unknown
www.geocities.com/autonomousangela

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: I would love the luxury of shopping around, but I live in a rulral area and there are only two ISP s I can use that have local access numbers. Keep checking to
messages.messageBody:
I would love the luxury of shopping around, but I live in a rulral area and there are only two ISP's I can use that have local access numbers. Keep checking to see if oters have added our area but no luck yet.
 
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Judie C. Rall
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 5:53 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus



> Johanna - Do not feel bad about the lack of anti-virus software.  I
have the software, yet I was affected.

I don't have to worry about viruses because, even though I have anti-
virus software on my computer, my internet service provider filters
every email before it comes to my inbox.  Perhaps you should
shop around and find an internet service provider in your area that
does this also.  Then you wouldn't have to worry so much.  My ISP
always has the latest DAT files with the newest virus information,
so I don't worry.

Judie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: ... Pris, come out from your rock, dear, I miss you!!! Tracy
messages.messageBody:
> I just received one from Debi B(urns), sorry I don't remember your
> last name b/c I deleted that lil sucker so fast didn't have time ta
> look; nothing personal, of course, Debi :)
>
> before I go back under my rock again, I must say, I'm really enjoying
> ALL the conversations lately; ya'll are a *hoot* ... Pris in TX (dss
> 12/10) :)
>
>
Pris, come out from your rock, dear, I miss you!!!

Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: ... get a free one!  I use Inoculate from CAI, I can;t remember the proper website but if you go to www.download.com and look up virus software you should find
messages.messageBody:
> it waits about five minutes, then your incoming mail start going into
> your outgoing mail instead. the attachment is added and it comes
> through the inbox as if you sent it. If you are posting to a group. it
> seems to come as a personal response to a post someone has sent. If
> you download your mail, log off and read it, the worm won't activate
> until you log on the net again. did you open any attachments? It gives
> an error meassage stating "File data corrupt: probably due to a bad
> data transmission or bad disk access." I don't think it works if you
> don't open the attachment but I'm not sure. I hope you are ok. I feel
> really bad because I knew I needed to get antivrus software and hadn't
> done it yet. Finances can be tight sometimes. Johanna Life is the
> ultimate learning experience!

get a free one! I use Inoculate from CAI, I can;t remember the
proper website but if you go to www.download.com and look up
virus software you should find it. However I did a full virus scan
after getting these messages (I figured out it was the ones with the
three 'RE's in the subject header, so i don't even have to open the
message, I know this can be a problem for OE users) and it didn't
find anything, even with a fresh update, so either I wasn't infected
cos I use Pegasus email reader or Inoculate doesn't have av for this
one yet :-( but I haven't seen any of mine go out odd...

Tracy

messages.subject: ] virus
messages.msgSnippet: My husband the computer guy says if anyone needs help getting rid of the virus, they can email me off list and he ll help them. Juli ===== You cannot teach a
messages.messageBody:
My husband the computer guy says if anyone needs help
getting rid of the virus, they can email me off list
and he'll help them. Juli


=====
You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him to find it within himself --Galileo

messages.subject: Re: virus
messages.msgSnippet: ... Appears I have the virus too.  My virus detector missed it. So please be careful of any email you get from me.  My son is coming to *de bug* next week. Can
messages.messageBody:
> > the attached virus).
> >
> YES me too. I got mine yesterday.
> Marianne



Appears I have the virus too. My virus detector missed it. So please
be careful of any email you get from me. My son is coming to *de
bug* next week.
Can I still read my message boards, as long as I dont post?

Marianne

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: I went and checked it out, and she joined in February, but I don t think I can do anything to take her address out. I think it has to be whoever started the
messages.messageBody:
I went and checked it out, and she joined in February,
but I don't think I can do anything to take her
address out. I think it has to be whoever started the
group, the moderator or whatever. Juli

--- SandraDodd@... wrote:
>
> In a message dated 4/20/01 8:50:37 AM,
> bvanbrunt4@... writes:
>
> << Well, I just got the "> Take a look to the
> attachment." from
> "R Meyers" <livinglighthouse@...>
> Just wanted to let him/her know that that account is
> infected. >>
>
> They're coming by private mail too, not to the list.
> I've gotten six just
> this morning, from that address, without message
> (except a quote from me and
> the attached virus).
>
> Are there people with yahoogroup list privileges
> here besides Lisa who's not
> online right now? If so, could someone remove that
> account from the
> yahoogroups list until such time as it can be
> stopped and cleared up? Thanks.
>
> Sandra
>


=====

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: ... have the software, yet I was affected. I don t have to worry about viruses because, even though I have anti- virus software on my computer, my internet
messages.messageBody:
> Johanna - Do not feel bad about the lack of anti-virus software. I
have the software, yet I was affected.

I don't have to worry about viruses because, even though I have anti-
virus software on my computer, my internet service provider filters
every email before it comes to my inbox. Perhaps you should
shop around and find an internet service provider in your area that
does this also. Then you wouldn't have to worry so much. My ISP
always has the latest DAT files with the newest virus information,
so I don't worry.

Judie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.messageBody:
<<How would you know if your computer has this virus? I haven't noticed
anything unusual but I know very little about computers? Any help is
appreciated.

Mary >>

I'm assuming you use Windows. Go to "Start" then "Find" and have it look
for these files,
kern32.exe
inetd.exe
hkk32.exe *note* this file means that the "trojan horse" aspect of the
virus was executed and it is the cause for real concern. It can capture
and transmit passwords, credit card information and other security
information stored on your hard drive.

If you don't have any of these files you are probably fine. If you
haven't opened any attachments for the past couple of weeks you are fine.
If you have opened ANY attachment from an email with no message except a
quote from one of your own posts along with a note "look to the
attachment" then you have the virus.

Kris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.messageBody:
<<I tried to open a similar email from Valerie. Hey Valerie are you out
there? Dh had just reloloaded out computer and I don't think the anti
virus software got loaded on before he left for WA. I want to make sure
I am not spreading anything. What happens with the virus? NOthing seems
to be wrong with my computer right now.>>

You'll know if you have it by searching for the following files:

kern32.exe
inetd.exe
Hkk32.exe

If none of these files are on your computer you are probably fine.

Kris

Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.messageBody:
<<ok I just got the look to the attatchment from someone on the list, but
I did not open the attatchment am I ok?
I opened the email and read the email but did not double click to open
the attatchment then I deleted it and deleted it from the deleted box
Tanya>>

As long as you didn't try to open the attachment you should be fine. A
friend (computer tech support) told me that you can even download the
program onto your hard drive and be fine, it's only when you open it
since it is an executable file, opening it starts it up.

You can do a search and see if you have any of the files on your hard
drive just to be safe.

Kris

something about what you said. So, I'm not going to
send anything else after this until I have dh the
computer guy look at it. Until then, my sweets! ;)
Juli

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus
messages.msgSnippet: it waits about five minutes, then your incoming mail start going into your outgoing mail instead. the attachment is added and it comes through the inbox as if
messages.messageBody:
it waits about five minutes, then your incoming mail start going into your outgoing mail instead. the attachment is added and it comes through the inbox as if you sent it. If you are posting to a group. it seems to come as a personal response to a post someone has sent. If you download your mail, log off and read it, the worm won't activate until you log on the net again. did you open any attachments? It gives an error meassage stating "File data corrupt: probably due to a bad data transmission or bad disk access." I don't think it works if you don't open the attachment but I'm not sure. I hope you are ok. I feel really bad because I knew I needed to get antivrus software and hadn't done it yet. Finances can be tight sometimes.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Angela
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 20, 2001 6:33 AM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] virus

I tried to open a similar email from Valerie.  Hey Valerie are you out there?   Dh had just reloloaded out computer and I don't think the anti virus software got loaded on before he left for WA.  I want to make sure I am not spreading anything.  What happens with the virus?  NOthing seems to be wrong with my computer right now.
 
 

Angela in Maine.  Unschooling Mom to two beautiful daughters.  "Play is our brain's favorite way to learn." Unknown
www.geocities.com/autonomousangela

messages.subject: virus
messages.msgSnippet: I was infected with a computer worm (as this one is appropriately called) early this morning.  it is called w32.Badtrans.13312@mm Anything saying look to the
messages.messageBody:
I was infected with a computer worm (as this one is appropriately called) early this morning.  it is called w32.Badtrans.13312@mm Anything saying look to the attachment activates it. I have spent the entire day debugging my computer. I apologize to anyone who I might have affected. I believe Tracy and Rachel in CA  were two who did receive it. It doesn't do a lot of damage to you computer personally, but will spread like wildfire if not stopped right away.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
